name: Queen Liliʻuokalani
description: Last reigning monarch of Hawaii who fought to preserve Hawaiian sovereignty and culture against American annexation
philosophy: My earnest hope is that my country will be restored to its rightful owners. I yield to the superior force of the United States, but I do not relinquish my claim to the Hawaiian Islands.
contributions: Composed 'Aloha ʻOe' and other beloved Hawaiian songs
quotes: Oh, honest Americans, as Christians hear me for my downtrodden people! Their form of worship is not changed; they pray now only in secret; they do not comprehend why they are denied freedom of religious thought.
I could not turn back the time for political change, but there is still time to save our heritage.
